snippet: The university will offer assistance only on primary residences and its president, John Sexton, will step down at the end of his term, according to a resolution released Wednesday.
abstract: New York University says that it will no longer lend money to top employees to buy vacation homes, and that it will grant faculty members more participation in school decisions; move is part of slate of changes designed to ease tensions between university leaders and its rank-and-file professors; university also announces that is president John Sexton will step down once his term ends in 2016.
lead_paragraph: The university will offer assistance only on primary residences and its president, John Sexton, will step down at the end of his term, according to a resolution released Wednesday.

headline.main: Facing Criticism, N.Y.U. Will Cease Loans to Top Employees for Second Homes
headline.print_headline: Facing Criticism, N.Y.U. Will Cease Loans to Top Employees for Second Homes
